definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: In other places, the coexistence continues.
sentences.chinese: 在其他地方，这种清音和浊音仍然共存。

sentences.english: The simulation results show that the proposed method can separate unvoiced and voiced signals.
sentences.chinese: 仿真结果表明，该方法可以分离清音和浊音信号。

sentences.english: Shifting dullness and a fluid wave are more difficult to elicit and require more ascites.
sentences.chinese: 移动性浊音和流体波更难引出而且需要更大量的腹水。

sentences.english: Ascites can be determined most easily by the demonstration of flank dullness.
sentences.chinese: 可通过出现侧腹部浊音最简便地发现腹水。

sentences.english: He has dullness to percussion and spider angiomas.
sentences.chinese: 他肚子叩诊上去浊音，并且蜘蛛痣。

sentences.english: And a trend of devocalization in sonant can also be found.
sentences.chinese: 辅音清浊对立逐渐消失，有浊音清化的趋势。

sentences.english: Voiced speech is interpreted as a concatenation of slowly evolving pitch cycle waveforms.
sentences.chinese: 浊音语音可以看作是慢变化的基音周期波形的连接。

sentences.english: Learn pairs of consonants that are voiced and voiceless and practice through minimal pairs.
sentences.chinese: 将清音和浊音的辅音通过最小对立组进行成对练习。

sentences.english: During the initial assessment of a client the nurse percusses dullness.
sentences.chinese: 在最初的评估期间，护士叩诊浊音，她知道浊音是。

sentences.english: During the initial assessment of a client the nurse percusses dullness.
sentences.chinese: 在最初的评估期间，护士叩诊浊音，她知道浊音是。

definition: (phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
